header.title: Woman arrested following video of homophobic abuse at Pride March
header.postText: A 38-year-old woman has been arrested after homophobic abuse was hurled at people taking part in a Pride march.', 'Footage shared on social media showed a woman in a black niqab repeatedly shouting ‘shame on you’ at passing participants, one of whom was wearing a rainbow LGBT flag.', 'In the video taken on Saturday in Waltham Forest, east London, the woman can be heard quoting Alan Partridge, shouting: ‘God created Adam and Eve, not Adam and Steve.', '‘Shame on you, you despicable people. Shame on you, you shameless people.’', 'Despite the abuse, one of the victims replies: ‘We still love you, you will not shame me,’ as a steward in a yellow vest tries to separate them,', 'The Metropolitan Police’s Waltham Forest Twitter account posted: ‘Officers investigating footage circulating on social media of abuse directed at those taking part in a Pride event in Waltham Forest have arrested a 38-year-old woman under section 4a of the Public Order Act.', '‘She has been taken into custody at a north London police station.’
header.socioLingVar: Gender - General,Age - General,Age - Youngsters,Ethnicity - Black,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments

commentThread.commentText: How did they identify the woman dressed from head to toe in black? By her eyes? How do they know that they have the righ t woman?
If you don't like it love, leave. There's plenty of countries left who hold your views where you can go and live. And take the school protesters from the midlands with you when you go.

replies.commentText: What’s that got to do with school protester? People have a right to know school teaches their children

Ibrahim Ibz Meah People have the right to know what children learn, of course. But not to protest against what is being taught at school, parents should not intervene! Parents educate their children at home, and the State educate children in the schools!, where the children learn how to respect each other and learn the basics of our societies! There should be no tolerance on those so call "parents" who protest what is being taught in our school especially when respect is being taught!
Ibrahim Ibz Meah So is it ok to protest the teaching of Islam in English schools ?

Yoko Kinoshita yes thought about education instead of science, math, Engineering, what they teach them in young age every parents have a responsibility and duty to know. Yes shouldn’t put someone else value and ideology in those children I’m glad those parents protested good on them
Danny Kirton we are not talking about islam here if someone doesn’t want to learn about islam nobody will force them to learn
Danny Kirton unless you’re stupid and dumb it’s called religious class if someone doesn’t want to learn nobody will force them
Ibrahim Ibz Meah The protesters in question aren't objecting about if they know what's on the curriculum, they're protesting that their kids are being taught not to be bigots.
Ibrahim Ibz Meah So if your kids said they didn't want to learn about islam you'd go "ok fair enough" would you?

Ibrahim Ibz Meah OF course they are taught, science, maths, enginering, history... but Education too! An it is not "someone else's" ideology or value who are being taught in our schools but our society's, our country's values and that should be taught to children from a very young age! And no! parents should not intervene on what is taught in our schools, informed yes! intervene no!
Ibrahim Ibz Meah if you are from Britain, the word is maths not math.

commentThread.commentText: What a total waste of police time and tax payers money! These minority groups need to get a grip of themselves.

replies.commentText: But there not the minority anymore. Our leaders bow down to them every time and why the burker has not been banned is beyond me. We are a terroists country so we should be able to see who is walking towards us.

commentThread.commentText: I'd like to see the line-up. Lol
I hope she goes to prison.

Wouldn't surprise me if they had arrested the participant from the Parade. After all they don't want to upset the "Burkha Brigade".There is no mention of which one was arrested.Just that "A woman has been arrested"

replies.commentText: What a moronic statement, it is obvious who was arrested as only one person in the article was commiting a criminal act. Almost as moronic as your pathetic attempt at propaganda.

commentThread.commentText: Police Said they had arrested a person disguised as a letter box

The ultimate consequences of her invasive ideology are serious injury and death. Personally, I'd love to see a Pride Parade with a contingent of niqab wearing drag queens.Even a short stint in prison would help send a message to others of a similar and dangerous perspective , that equality of tax payers is taken seriously in a democracy.How many times are we reminded of the limits of free speech by the extremes from afar?
Will be interesting to see what, if anything they do to her.Hate crime is hate crime and should be treated as such, even if they do try to hide behind some dodgy religious dogma.
As they gain population numbers, and they are, they will change the Laws. This is inevitable.
